text: William A. Gabor (May 13, 1922 â€“ June 4, 2019) was an American professional basketball player. He played as a point guard. Between 1948 and 1955, he played for the Syracuse Nationals of the National Basketball League and later the National Basketball Association. He was an NBA champion in 1955 and an NBA All-Star in 1953. At the time of his death in 2019, he was believed to the oldest living former NBA player. Gabor was born in Binghamton, New York. He died of pneumonia on June 4, 2019 in Jupiter, Florida. He was 97. ==References== ==Other websites== *Billy Gabor at Basketball-Reference.com Category:1922 births Category:2019 deaths Category:American basketball players Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Infectious disease deaths in Florida Category:Military people from New York (state) Category:People from Binghamton, New York Category:Point guards Category:Sportspeople from New York (state)
title: Billy Gabor
